name: charger
content:
charger noun [C]
(DEVICE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a device that is used to recharge a battery (= fill it with electricity), for example the battery in a mobile phone: I left my phone charger in the hotel room. This cordless electric saw costs about $200 and comes with a charger and carrying case.
aimy27feb/ iStock / Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThese radios are usually battery powered, but this one also has solar charger. The device will plug into a car charger or USB.It resembles a video camera and comes with a rechargeable battery and a battery charger. This portable charger can be charged up from the mains and will give your devices up to 96 more hours of battery life.

charger noun [C]
(HORSE)
old use or literary a soldier's horse: A cliché of romantic fiction was for the heroine to be rescued by a knight on a white charger. He insisted that he would lead his men into battle mounted on his charger.
